poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: A thousand flowers bloomed The jade-toothed chairman boomed Some suckers booed and that was that, No bud but bowed to the chairman's Flocks that browsed, that ruminate still And brood on his one-liners, brewed as tinctures. How they boozed! Prisoners, with luck Were bound and bruised. At best That was what happened.
